titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Bert Hansen Collection of Advertising Fans
circa early 20th century-circa 2003
PR 438
titlestmt.author: Ali Barr and Larry Weimer

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 15:48:20 -0400.

did.unittitle: Bert Hansen collection of advertising fans
did.abstract: The collection holds 114 advertising fans collected by historian and gay activist Bert Hansen. Represented in the collection are funeral homes (many of which are owned by African-Americans), drugstores, drug products, coal supply, retail stores, churches, printing services, and others. The fans are mostly undated but seem to range from the first half of the 20th century to the early 2000s. Most fans include religious, scenic, photographic, or other imagery. The later fans include public service messages and advocacy, as well as advertising.
did.physloc: For more information on making arrangements to consult the collection, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: The bulk of the documents in the collection are in English, wth a few in French and one in Spanish.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is in the original order as presented to N-YHS by the collector, which generally was grouped by the estimated age of the fan (i.e., "antique," "vintage," "modern"). Each fan is designated with an item number (e.g., BH.001); these numbers were assigned by the collector.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: For more information on making arrangements to consult the collection, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the collector, Bert Hansen, in November 2021.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The collection should be cited as: Bert Hansen collection of advertising fans, PR 438, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed in March-April 2022 by volunteer Alison Barr and archivist Larry Weimer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection holds 114 advertising fans collected by historian and gay activist Bert Hansen. About 30 of the fans advertise funeral homes, many of which make clear their African-American ownership or connection to the Black community. About 30 fans advertise drugstores, drug products, or certain medical services, such as dental work and chiropractors. Other businesses represented are milling, coal supply, car dealers, retail stores (e.g., home furnishings, dry goods), churches, and others. Some fans seem to be samples that advertise the services of the fan's printer. Fans characterized by the collector as "modern," that is, dating from approximately the 1990s to the early 2000s, also include public service messages (e.g., railway crossing safety, environmental/clean water), advocacy (e.g., Gay Men's Health Crisis/AIDS), and Broadway theater publicity, among others.

Most of the fans include imagery, such as drawings or photographs. Images often depict scenes that are religious (usually Christian), serene country/rural, romantic/sentimental Americana, drawings of products, and others. Some are more text-heavy about products, especially those related to drugstores or later public service messages. Geographically, the bulk of the fans are from the United States, but no particular state or region predominates.

The bulk of the fans are undated. The terms "antique," "vintage," and "modern" are used in the container list. These were provided by the collector. It appears that "antique" refers to fans estimated to date from the first half of the 20th century, "vintage" refers to those estimated to date from the 1950s to 1970s, and "modern" to those estimated to date from the 1980s to early 2000s.

All fans in the collection are listed in the container list. The donor provided an Excel spreadsheet with the collection that includes the collector's detailed descriptions of the items and commentary on many of them. A copy of these descriptions is included in each of the three boxes holding the collection. The descriptions used in this finding aid's container list were derived from elements of the collector's Excel spreadsheet, along with the processing archivist's observations of the objects. The container list descriptions provide a basic physical description of the fan (as provided by the collector) and imagery, reference to the product or business/organization advertised, and, if indicated on the fan, the printer/manufacturer. The few dates in the container list are those explicitly recorded on the fan or those that could be readily determined from context.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Bert Hansen (1944-) is Professor Emeritus of History at Baruch College of the City University of New York, where he taught from 1991-2015. His principal areas of research and writing have been in science, medicine and public health. Since the 1970s, Hansen has been an activist for gay rights and, in the 1980s, engaged with the AIDS movement. During the course of his professional research and activism, he has collected a range of documents, scientific instruments, prints, objects, and other material that he has donated to various institutions, including Yale, the New York Academy of Medicine, and others, including New-York Historical Society.
(The above note was derived from Bert Hansen's website. A fuller note and links to his writings, etc. can be found there: https://www.berthansen.com/ )

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: N-YHS's Ephemera Collection (PR 264) holds about 500 advertising postcards that were also collected and, in 2000, donated by Bert Hansen.

did.unittitle: Inventory and item notes provided by collector Bert Hansen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wide oval. Portrait of George Washington. Coopersburg Casket Company, Coopersburg, Pennsylvania.

did.unittitle: BH-002. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dye cut rectangular with image partly protruding. Shamrock brand of Sunkist Valencias (oranges), from Northern Orange County. Printer: Western Litho. Co., in Los Angeles.

did.unittitle: BH-003. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Balloon shape. Illustration on front of woman holding a product (Triena brand) with images of other packages, for Allied Drug Products Co., Chattanooga, Tennessee; and illustration on back of Dr. Thacher's laxative compound of senna and rhubarb. R. L. Hopper, General Merchandise, Elwood, Texas.

did.unittitle: BH-004. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color painting of girl, boy, and dog outside a drug store, with publicity for brands Nature's Remedy laxative and Tums. Hepler's Drug Store, New Bethlehem, Pennsylvania.

did.unittitle: BH-005. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color painting on front of a sailboat moving fast; blank on back. Publicity for brands Nature's Remedy laxative and Tums.

did.unittitle: BH-006. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Front has exactly the same text and image as BH-005 (color painting of a sailboat moving fast), but has content on back. Publicity for brands Nature's Remedy laxative and Tums. The Dickinson Drug Co., Abingdon, Illinois.

did.unittitle: BH-007. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color painting ("First Aid" by Norman Price) of 3 children, with a dog, play-acting pharmacist, nurse and patient. Ernest F. Birbeck, Optician, Plaza Hotel, Camden, N.J.

did.unittitle: BH-008. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded badge shape. Color painted illustration of an autumn harvest scene with corn shocks in autumn light. Boydton Drug Store, Inc. Boydton, Virginia. Printer: Merchants Pub. Co., Kalamazoo, Michigan.

did.unittitle: BH-009. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded badge shape. Color painted illustration portrait of young woman in swimsuit. The Selma Drug Co., Selma, North Carolina. Printer: The Harrison Co., Inc. Union City, Indiana.

did.unittitle: BH-010. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Circular. Color painted illustration of woman in bathing suit waving to someone from her seat on a sailboat out on the water. Lebanon Fair. Printer: Boyer Printing & Binding Co., Lebanon, Pennsylvania.

did.unittitle: BH-011. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Color illustration of Diana or Artemis, the hunter with bow, arrows, and a sleek greyhound like dog. Publicity for brand 666 product line (liquid, salve, tablet, nose drops). Stover's, Trenton [New Jersey?].

did.unittitle: BH-012. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Squarish badge shape. Color painting of little girl holding a puppy beside a pond. Dr. Wm. H. Stippich, chiropractor and natureopath, Meriden, Conn.

did.unittitle: BH-013. Antique with continuous cardboard handle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pentagonal shape. Color painted illustration of little boy pushing a wheelbarrow holding 7 babies. Publicity for Dicks' Chillifuge, a malaria remedy. F. A. Dicks and Co., Inc., New Orleans.

did.unittitle: BH-014. Antique tri-fold expandable around a metal grommet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vase shape when closed. Color painting of Jesus on the Mount of Olives. Swallow Funeral Home, Northampton, Pennsylvania. Printer: Messenger Corp., Auburn, Indiana.

did.unittitle: BH-015. Antique tri-fold expandable around a metal grommet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vase shape when closed. Color painting of an American flag on a pole flying in the wind, against a dramatic set of clouds, with Pledge of Allegiance. One section on the back has photo of the proprietor and listing for Echternacht Funeral Home, at 1900 Central Ave., [Kansas City, Kansas]. Added to central piece by hand: "Stephens Memorial Meth. Church."

did.unittitle: BH-016. Antique tri-fold expandable around a metal grommet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vase shape when closed. Color photograph of a formal flower arrangement with a black background. This seems to be a printer's sample; Printer: U.O. Colson Company, Paris, Illinois. Stamped "For Minnows, Worms, and Accessories, call AT 5908 Troost."

did.unittitle: BH-017. Antique tri-fold expandable around a metal grommet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vase shape when closed. Color photograph of a formal flower arrangement (mostly red roses) with a blank green background. Lawrence D. Rouse Inc. with addresses in St. Albans and Wantaugh on Long Island, NY. Printer: Messenger Corp., Auburn, Indiana.

did.unittitle: BH-018. Antique tri-fold expandable around a metal grommet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vase shape when closed. Color photograph of white church in between two forested hills. F.L. Wadhams & Sons, Inc., (coal, fuel oil, grain and feed), Torrington, Connecticut. Printer: Newton Mfg. Co., Newton, Iowa.

did.unittitle: BH-019. Antique tri-fold expandable around a metal grommet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vase shape when closed. Color painting of rural scene centered on farmhouse with smoke rising from the chimney in autumn. Main text on back appears to be from a women's apparel shop, Hartley's, in Miami, but that might be fiction as it is clearly a printer's sample since it has prices for fans in bulk. Printer: U.O. Colson Co.

did.unittitle: BH-020. Antique tri-fold expandable around a metal grommet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vase shape when closed. Color painting of a winter scene among tall trees with a country house in the center, with lighted windows and smoke rising from the chimney. Woodruff Coal Co., Bridgeton, New Jersey. Printer: Banker's Advertising Co., Iowa City, Iowa. (Copy 1, identical to BH-021)

did.unittitle: BH-021. Antique tri-fold expandable around a metal grommet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vase shape when closed. Color painting of a winter scene among tall trees with a country house in the center, with lighted windows and smoke rising from the chimney. Woodruff Coal Co., Bridgeton, New Jersey. Printer: Banker's Advertising Co., Iowa City, Iowa. (Copy 2, identical to BH-020)

did.unittitle: BH-022. Antique tri-fold expandable around a metal grommet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vase shape when closed. Sentimental painting of "A Faithful Guardian," scene of a raft bearing a sitting but alert St. Bernard dog and a small boy seated between his paws and holding on to the dog's furry chest, looking frightened. Field's Stationery, West Somerville, Massachusetts. Printer: Leroy, Inc., Union City, N.J.

did.unittitle: BH-023. Antique tri-fold expandable around a metal grommet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vase shape when closed. Color photograph, wide angle of a garden park in the south on a body of water, with four women in colorful ball gowns promenading on a walk and across a footbridge. J.W. Hallowell & Sons, Inc., (Chevrolet, Oldsmobile), Federalsburg, Maryland.

did.unittitle: BH-024. Antique tri-fold expandable around a metal grommet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vase shape when closed. Painted illustration of southern scenes: a bayou with a riverboat under a moonlit sky, young elite couple, log cabin with a smoking chimney, and two Black men playing banjoes seated on the dock. Kreamer Funeral Service, Annville, Pennsylvania.

did.unittitle: BH-025. Antique quadri-fold around a metal grommet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fan-shaped when closed. This style is uncommon and is the only one in this collection. Drawings of two birds in a tree. Lincoln-Income Life Insurance Co., Louisville, Kentucky.

did.unittitle: BH-026. Antique single piece with wood handle, only foreign example

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Shaped like a feathered fan. From Spain, the only non-American fan in the collection. Painted to look like a feathered fan, including a black-and-white portrait photograph of the actress Marion Davies. Publicity for remedy Digestona Chorro from Gabriel Ruiz Chorro, in the town of Elche in Spain. Printer: Union Bolsera Madrilena. Text is in Spanish.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Flat-top oval. Color painting of "Capri and Vesuvius." Heater's Barber Shop (and hunting and fishing supplies), Alburtis, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. 1st of 8 fans with the same kind of black and white photograph in a light green architectural border. This fan's photograph is titled "A Shady Spot" and noted as copyright 1902 by Chas. Williams. The product being promoted is "laxative celeri bromure" for headache. Text is in French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. 2nd of 8 fans with the same kind of black and white photograph in a light green architectural border. This fan's photograph is titled "A Morning Call" and noted as copyright 1902 by Chas. Williams. The product being promoted is "laxative celeri bromure" for headache. Text is in French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. 3rd of 8 fans with the same kind of black and white photograph in a light green architectural border. This fan's photograph is titled "This Little Pig Went to Market" and noted as copyright 1893 by W.H. Rau. The product being promoted is "laxative celeri bromure" for headache. Text is in French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. 4th of 8 fans with the same kind of black and white photograph in a light green architectural border. This fan's photograph is titled "And the cat came back" and noted as copyright 1894 by W.H. Rau. The product being promoted is "laxative celery bromide" for headache. Text is in English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. 5th of 8 fans with the same kind of black and white photograph in a light green architectural border. This fan's photograph is titled "And the cat came back" and noted as copyright 1894 by W.H. Rau. The product being promoted is "laxative celeri bromure" for headache. Text is in French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. 6th of 8 fans with the same kind of black and white photograph in a light green architectural border. This fan's photograph is titled "Nibbling at the bait" and noted as copyright 1897 by W.H. Rau. The product being promoted is "laxative celery bromide" for headache. Text is in English. Copy 1, identical to BH.034.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. 7th of 8 fans with the same kind of black and white photograph in a light green architectural border. This fan's photograph is titled "Nibbling at the bait" and noted as copyright 1897 by W.H. Rau. The product being promoted is "laxative celery bromide" for headache. Text is in English. Copy 2, identical to BH.033.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. 8th of 8 fans with the same kind of black and white photograph in a light green architectural border. This fan's photograph is titled "Nibbling at the bait" and noted as copyright 1897 by W.H. Rau. The product being promoted is "laxative celeri bromure" for headache. Text is in French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Badge-like shape. Color image of mountains with waterfall. W.A. Pierce, druggist, the Rexall store in West Chester, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Badge-like shape. Color image of clown applying face paint to a boy. Fuhrer Brothers Pharmacy, the Rexall Store in Livingston Manor, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Badge-like shape. Color portrait of an elegantly dressed woman. Fuhrer Brothers Pharmacy, the Rexall store in Livingston Manor, New York. Printer: Brown & Bigelow, St. Paul.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Painted winter night scene of country house with lighted windows. Selma Drug Company. Printer: Beckman Co., Philadelphia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Painted scene of a river in a forest in the mountains. Selma Drug Company. Printer: Beckman Co., Philadelphia.

did.unittitle: Inventory and item notes provided by collector Bert Hansen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Painted scene of a girl and her dog sitting in an elaborate garden outside her house. Selma Drug Company. Printer: Beckman Co., Philadelphia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded square. Color painting of little girl on an old-fashioned wall phone, gold embossed thistle border. Wellman's Pharmacy, Tampa, Florida. Printer: Kemper-Thomas Company, Cincinnati, Ohio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Flattened circle. Painted illustration of two little boys in kilts and caps against a prominent yellow background. Publicity for brand 666 product line (liquid, tablets, salve, nose drops). L. E. Stauffer, druggist, Union Bridge. Printer: B. & B., St. Paul.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Squarish badge shape. Front has painted illustration of little boy and 3 birds on a snowy branch, against a strong yellow background, singing the "666 Carol." Publicity for brand 666 product line (liquid, tablets, salve, nose drops). Bucher Pharmacy, Inc. Printer: U.O. Colson, Co., Paris, Illinois.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tall, narrow rectangle. Front has a black and white portrait photograph of "The dentist who does not hurt, Dr. Algase," likely of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Photographs of office, staff and price list for services.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Large rounded badge shape. Walter Hufham, druggist, Morehead City, North Carolina. Publicity for various products carried by the Rexall agent. Printer: U.O. Colson Co., Paris, Illinois.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scalloped rectangle. Painted color illustration of four children around a table at birthday party, signed by Frances Tipton Hunter. H.C. Primm Co. (shoe store), Harper and Freeport.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rectangle. Publicity for Putnam Fadeless Dyes-Tints. Color image of Putnam founder E.N. Monroe with great granddaughter, Diann. P.E. Sander's Grocery, Shelbyville, Missouri. Printer: The Regensteiner Corporation, Chicago, Illinois.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rectangle. 2nd of 3 fans with publicity for Putnam Fadeless Dyes-Tints and other Putnam products. Drawing of woman painting the coloring on a large butterfly or moth's wings, with fairy helpers nearby holding pots of pigments. Sime & Barron, dry goods and groceries, Cottage Grove, Wisconsin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rectangle. 3rd of 3 fans with publicity for Putnam Fadeless Dyes-Tints and other Putnam products. Drawing of woman painting the coloring on a large butterfly or moth's wings, with fairy helpers nearby holding pots of pigments. Hoornbeek Bros., Napanoch, New York. Printer: The Regensteiner Corporation, Chicago, Illinois.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Flattened circle. Color illustration of "The Champion," a toddler as a boxer with gloved hands holding the rope. Healy Chapel, Aurora, Illinois. Printer: The Osborne Company, Clifton, New Jersey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Circle. Publicity for Aunt Jemima products, with portrait drawing of the fictional African-American character and images from the concocted "Life of Aunt Jemima." R.T. Davis Milling Co., St. Joseph, Missouri.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Image of Martin Luther King, Jr., with a framed picture of an unidentified woman, titled "Together Again." Winnfield Life Insurance Co., Natchitoches, Louisiana, with listings of branch offices and funeral homes in Louisiana. Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Portraits and quotations of John F. Kennedy, Martin Luther King, Jr., and Robert F. Kennedy, titled "These Americans Died For Freedom." House of Hills, Inc. Mortuary, Denver, Colorado. Photo of Thomas T. Hill, Licensed Mortician. Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color painting of "Mahalia Jackson, 1911-1972." Baker Funeral Homes, Inc. in Ft. Worth and Cleburne, Texas. Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Rural scene in color titled "Chapel in the Hills." Funk-Cooper-Warren Mortuary (and Ambulance Service), Lawrence, [Kansas]. Printer: Harley J. Scott, Kansas City, Missouri.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Image of Black woman holding her baby up. Garland Bros. Funeral Home, Syracuse, New York.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Rounded rectangle. Painting of Jesus with a flock of sheep, titled "The Good Shepherd." Feete Funeral Home, Brunswick, Maryland. Handwritten note on back: "June 1968, from United Church of Christ, Brunswick, MD 21716." Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bell-shaped cut out. Black College Fund, Division of Higher Education, General Board of Higher Education and Ministry, Nashville, Tennessee. With list of 12 historically black colleges and universities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color image of farm boy with straw hat and a dog on his lap, titled "Hi There." Clarke-Wilson Funeral Service, but possibly a publisher/printer's marketing sample. Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Front image is a black and white photograph of a hearse. Morty the Mortuary Machine party car, central Pennsylvania. For funeral-themed prank parties, such as bachelor and bachlorette parties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Image titled "Christ in Gethsemane." George C. Carson and Sons Funeral Homes in Independence and Kansas City, Missouri. Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color image of a white church with a high steeple titled "Chapel on the Hill." Center Place Savings, but limited other information so possibly a publisher/printer marketing sample. Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color photo of a Midwestern farm with wide horizon titled "Tranquil Beauty." Babcock Home Furnishing Centers, New Smyrna Beach, Florida. Printer: Bagley Specialty Advertising, Lakeland, Florida. Various notations were made on the fan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color photograph of a lake in the mountains titled "Timberline Lake." Duffy-Behrendt Funeral Home, Pontiac, Illinois, and Watson Funeral Home in Odell, Illinois.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color photo of church in rolling landscape titled "Autumn Splendor." Welch's Store, Centennial 1866-1966, Minnesota Lake, Minnesota. Copy 1; see BH-067.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color photo of church in rolling landscape titled "Autumn Splendor." Welch's Store, Centennial 1866-1966, Minnesota Lake, Minnesota. Copy 2; see BH-066.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Pink-toned image of little girl dressed for church, holding a New Testament, titled "Youthful Worship." Kingston Funeral Home, Westridge Township. Possibly a publisher/printer marketing sample. Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color photo of current and early American flags. Gubernatorial campaign in Kansas, promoting Joan Finney for Governor and Jim Francisco for Lt. Governor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Portrait photograph of formally dressed man captioned Maceo A. Thomas, Jr., Owner. Rollerson & Thomas, Inc. Funeral Home, New York, and the Highbridge Funeral Home, Inc. in the Bronx.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Image of church in tropical setting, urging support for one's community church. Lawrence Sanitary Milk & Ice Cream Co. Printer: Harley J. Scott Co., Kansas City, Missouri.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Line drawing of Jesus as shepherd, with 23rd Psalm. Kirkhoff Funeral Home, Bernville, Pennsylvania. Printer: Hal Roth Adv. Products, Reading, PA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Line drawing of palm trees, around an open page listing famous Bible passages as "God's Answer to all Problems." Harvey A. Hill, Jr., Funeral Director. Printer: Kennedy & Kennedy Co., Chicago, Illinois. Copy 1, see BH-074.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Line drawing of palm trees, around an open page listing famous Bible passages as "God's Answer to all Problems." Harvey A. Hill, Jr., Funeral Director. Printer: Kennedy & Kennedy Co., Chicago, Illinois. Copy 2, see BH-073.

did.unittitle: Inventory and item notes provided by collector Bert Hansen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Flat-top oval. Front has a gold design on a royal blue ground that appears to be a monogram, with H & H in gothic lettering. Highbridge/Rollerson and Thomas Funeral Home, Bronx, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color photo of flowering shrubs around a lawn in front of a suburban one-story house, titled "An Inviting Setting." Chas. D. Cox, Bricklayer and Builder, and Evelyn's Beauty Shoppe, Bernville, Pennsylvania. Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer; Standard Cal. Co., Madison, Illinois.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Painting of a white-robed Jesus outside a wooden door in a stone building, titled "Christ Knocking at the Door." Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color photograph of a formal flower arrangement, titled "Rhapsody in Color." Bause's "Super" Drug Stores, in Pottstown and Boyertown. Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer; B. H Bustard, Cedars, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Color portrait photograph of a Black man in a pin-striped suit, in front of a paneled wall with a funeral-type flower arrangement partly visible. Likely Ben D. Johnson, noted on the fan as President of Winnfield Funeral Homes, in Natchitoches, Louisiana, with other homes in Louisiana listed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Three portrait photographs of the Black officers of Solomon's Mortuary, Los Angeles, California, and a wide photo of white funeral limos in front of the funeral home.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Painted portrait of "Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr." Taylor Funeral Home, Chicago, Illinois. Small photos of Charles B. Taylor and Leyeuna A. Taylor, funeral directors. Copyright (printer?): A. Scheer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rounded rectangle. Anti-smoking advocacy from American Association for Respiratory Care. Issued by Grand View Hospital, Respiratory Therapy, Sellersville, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
